skills.description: Essential skills organized into Starter (daily use) and Power (advanced workflow) tiers.

starter.description: 7 skills for daily agent-assisted development. Covers the core Research-Plan-Implement loop plus validation and status.

skills.name: council
skills.description: Multi-model consensus council. Spawns parallel judges with configurable perspectives.

skills.name: implement
skills.description: Execute a single issue with full lifecycle.

skills.name: plan
skills.description: Epic decomposition into trackable issues with dependency waves.

skills.name: research
skills.description: Deep codebase exploration with multi-angle analysis.

skills.name: rpi
skills.description: Full RPI lifecycle orchestrator. Discovery -> Implementation -> Validation.

skills.name: status
skills.description: Single-screen dashboard showing current work, recent validations, flywheel health, and suggested next action.

skills.name: vibe
skills.description: Comprehensive code validation. Complexity analysis then multi-model council.

power.description: 8 skills for advanced workflows: brainstorming, parallel execution, autonomous loops, knowledge capture, and release management.

skills.name: brainstorm
skills.description: Separate WHAT from HOW before planning. Clarify goals, explore approaches, capture structured design decisions.

skills.name: crank
skills.description: Hands-free epic execution. Runs until ALL children are CLOSED. Parallel wave execution via /swarm.

skills.name: evolve
skills.description: Goal-driven fitness-scored improvement loop. Measures goals, picks worst gap, runs /rpi, compounds via knowledge flywheel.

skills.name: learn
skills.description: Capture knowledge manually into the flywheel. Save a decision, pattern, lesson, or constraint for future sessions.

skills.name: post-mortem
skills.description: Wrap up completed work. Council validates the implementation, then extract learnings.

skills.name: pre-mortem
skills.description: Validate a plan or spec before implementation using multi-model council.
skills.note: Mandatory for 3+ issue epics. 6/6 consecutive positive ROI.

skills.name: release
skills.description: Pre-flight validation, changelog generation, version bumps, release commit, and tag.

skills.name: retro
skills.description: Extract learnings from completed work, propose proactive improvements, and feed the knowledge flywheel.

agents.description: 4 domain expert agent profiles for specialized task delegation.

profiles.name: researcher
profiles.description: Codebase exploration and knowledge synthesis. Read-only investigation with structured findings.
profiles.instructions: You are a codebase researcher. Explore target areas thoroughly using Glob and Grep. Read relevant files to understand architecture and patterns. Return structured findings with file:line references. Always provide: file inventory with key symbols, architecture overview, key patterns and conventions, potential concerns. Never modify files.

profiles.name: validator
profiles.description: Code quality, security, and architecture review. Multi-perspective judgment with prioritized findings.
profiles.instructions: You are a senior code reviewer and validation specialist. Run git diff to see recent changes. Review for quality, security, and maintainability. Provide feedback organized by priority: Critical (must fix), Warning (should fix), Suggestion (consider). Include specific code references and fix examples. Use /vibe for comprehensive validation and /council for multi-perspective judgment.

profiles.name: implementer
profiles.description: Issue execution with test coverage. Full write access for building features and fixing bugs.
profiles.instructions: You are an implementation specialist. Execute issues end-to-end: understand the requirement, write code, add tests, verify the build passes. Follow the implement skill workflow: pre-flight checks, read existing code, implement changes, run tests, commit. Always ensure test coverage for new code. Use /learn to capture patterns discovered during implementation.

profiles.name: operator
profiles.description: Release management, monitoring, and CI/CD operations. Manages the ship-and-learn cycle.
profiles.instructions: You are an operations specialist. Manage releases: pre-flight validation, changelog generation, version bumps, tagging. Monitor project health via /status and ao doctor. Run /retro to extract learnings after significant work. Use /evolve for autonomous improvement cycles. Always run scripts/ci-local-release.sh before tagging. Follow weekly release train cadence.

claude_md_template.description: CLAUDE.md template section for plugin install instructions. Add this to your project's CLAUDE.md to enable the vibe-kit.
content: # Install the ao CLI via Homebrew
/status                    # Where am I? What should I do next?
/rpi <goal>                # Full lifecycle: research -> plan -> implement -> validate
**Starter (daily use):** council, implement, plan, research, rpi, status, vibe
**Power (advanced):** brainstorm, crank, evolve, learn, post-mortem, pre-mortem, release, retro
Use these as `subagent_type` when spawning teammates:
| `validator` | Code quality, security, architecture review | sonnet |
| `implementer` | Issue execution with test coverage | opus |

selection_criteria.commands: Essential subset covering health, setup, knowledge, workflow, and validation. Excluded internal/maintenance commands.
selection_criteria.skills_starter: Core RPI loop skills plus judgment and status. Sufficient for daily agent-assisted development.
selection_criteria.skills_power: Advanced orchestration, autonomous loops, knowledge capture, and release management.
selection_criteria.agents: Four complementary profiles covering explore, validate, build, and ship. Model allocation by task complexity.
